alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Hennepin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 20 at 9:07PM CDT until further notice by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk affecting Hennepin and Anoka Counties. .Widespread flooding continues on area rivers. Additional rainfall from today and into Friday will keep river flows increased. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River AT Hwy 610 @ Brooklyn Pk. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 800 PM CDT Thursday, the stage was 16.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 800 PM CDT Thursday was 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 16.1 feet early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.8 feet on 04/15/2001. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
